pageContext.claim: “Manufacturing jobs growing at the fastest rate in more than three decades. We've created more than 400, 000 manufacturing jobs since my election. … And that's a number that was supposed to go way down and it's going way up.”
pageContext.analysis: U.S. manufacturing employment has been increasing at a steady rate since 2010, with 382,000 jobs added since Trump took office. Before Trump's election, economists expected that steady growth to continue.
